result.markdown:
---
title: "Hands-On Exercise 01 (A Layered Grammer of Graphics: ggplot2 methods)"
author: "Zanelle Lee Wenfang"
date-modified: "last-modified"
execute:
    echo: true
    eval: true
    warning: false
    freeze: true
---

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

#loading data into exam_data
exam_data <- read_csv("C:/Users/Zanelle/Downloads/ISSS608 Visual Analytics/Data files/Exam_data.csv")

#plot using R graphics
hist(exam_data$MATHS)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#plot using ggplot2
ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=10, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="black", 
                 fill="grey") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#bar chart
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#dot plot
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(dotsize = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#scale_y_continuous turns off y-axis, binwidth changes bins' width
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(binwidth=2.5,         
               dotsize = 0.5) +      
  scale_y_continuous(NULL,           
                     breaks = NULL)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-3.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#simple histogram, default bin is 30
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#bins = no. of bins, fill = colour histogram is shadedm colour = outline colour of bars
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,            
                 color="black",      
                 fill="light blue")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#changing interior colour of histogram using fill under aes()
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="grey30")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-3.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#geom_density plots kernal density estimate (smoothed version of histogram)
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_density()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#plotting 2 kernal density lines using colour (can also use fill under aes())
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS, 
           colour = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#geom_boxplot() for continuous value list
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS,       
           x= GENDER)) +    
  geom_boxplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#notches to assess if medians of distributions differ
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch=TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#geom_violin() for comparing multiple data distributions
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_violin()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-3.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#combining geom objects (geom_boxplot() and geom_point())
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +                    
  geom_point(position="jitter", 
             size = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#using stat_summary()
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",       
               fun = "mean",         
               colour ="red",        
               size=4)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#using geom_point()
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary",        
             fun="mean",           
             colour="red",          
             size=4)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#best fit curve on scatterplot
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(size=0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#override default smoothing method
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              linewidth=0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#trellis plot using facet_wrap()
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20) +
    facet_wrap(~ CLASS)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#trellis plot using facet_grid()
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20) +
    facet_grid(~ CLASS)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#flipped axis
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#fixing axis range
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#using themes
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_classic()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-4.png){width=672}
:::
:::
